313C985D85AB44A9876A7D90DE85FF6C.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

50F97980EC2B4082A3CC96A5E057D1A4.description: Verbally share on topic ideas, thoughts, feelings, and/or prayers in a group setting.

ACBB5A4783784530BDCA03B7194F2AA5.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

62E192EAD3724C11A740CB48FD9C0724.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

E2A72EA891204BD08C1158474F67C56E.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

1BD544C6726946EE87221C5F170B4F57.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

BE965659EA9545549FE5434C2918C9DF.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

4479466BC9354A238B8768A8D8B3125B.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

661B55AD0CEA41C8A5C3A70BA9D7B6DE.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

6459647B52AD4B90AB73DA60B11B6D87.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

E94FA8094D2047CF9675C008F65BC4E4.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

AEE4CBCA8E5745B885EA6F40E0282A83.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

CE2D143B7FB1475DBB5D157C1ABCB94A.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

86CDA10AF7B5470AB6BD8CB82FF90698.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

B0666A567C4E4FE2888B7D3AF0556DFD.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

A923FE0B2EAF4A5FA1E3FDA402544EAB.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

0EFE73568B9D4E84B9ABC87D22FF52B1.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

F5FEC17CCC88436A9337CFA5B8BEBF7E.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

B556EFA2931B48559828445ECC6458E7.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

94F0B8B732974C92B60103633D5FDAC0.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

8CAD3A82E5EF45218E7DCF2A726E97B3.description: Demonstrate understanding of conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

E53BAA50928442818207681CE95E8A0A.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

8AB7C7111F3C40C1A438A2A0F3F882E4.description: Use prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with) correctly.

396CCC829BBB46C9AE5F4261D1BDE97D.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

433EDC630DBF4D30A43C47A640C47DF9.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

A358FEBECE6F49F5AEB56C769661EC30.description: Use nouns and verbs correctly (Clarification 1: He runs.)

C0CD23098CD94E08BF0C5B6A971AAA70.description: Demonstrate developmentally-appropriate fluency of conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing and/or speaking.

AD7726FB19F942529B2068F5894813F9.description: Students will be able to legibly print a complete simple sentence on a topic that uses correct capitalization and end punctuation.

8A8440AB89B449B2A7D4E41A77AF3BC4.description: Participate in thematically-generated exploration on a variety of topics, books, experiences in which students share their understanding through their drawing, speaking, and ultimately writing.

9D2E4AAC762E432999FB6BFBE6706061.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

D6FA6AB47205438A8C872008DBA28BAD.description: Students will explore the use of a variety of digital devices to create text.

D57512702A90445EBF8940D768A7C7BE.description: Students will be able to legibly print all upper and lower case letters by the completion of the kindergarten year.

BE5583DD7D54481EA7E2BB78338EA961.description: Using teacher-led modeling, students will understand how written text can be made better with revising and editing; i.e. suggestions, ideas, questions, etc. about the text. Example: "I think you need to say what color the car is."

92A74CF856A04F0ABFDA184A153AF629.description: Through a progression of drawing, dictating, and writing, students will begin to relate sequences of events focusing on beginning, middle, and end. Example: Student can draw, dictate, and eventually write: "I got to school, then had recess, and went home."

44F859B11B1F4F9E9434BE512A8377F1.description: Through a progression of speaking, drawing and writing, students will share information in which they name what they are writing about, either teacher or student-directed topics, and supply details about the topic. Examples: Cars are fast and they can be in different colors.

FDBC770573924FE1A3D930A2BE07EA0A.description: Through a progression of speaking, drawing and writing, student will express likes and dislikes about a given topic or book, with details to support their opinions. Examples: I like this book because it is funny; I don't like winter because it is cold.

68C53EAF5D2444D885A85CAE0598F93B.description: Actively and respectfully engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

079EC056737C4EEF8FF4A8A9FBCD5820.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

823BC2A1FA944A4A95271D304636B604.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast story elements in works of fiction.

D10D9DEC2F004928806EB0C94F21F986.description: With prompting and support, understand the roles of author and illustrator in telling the story.

75D2391FEA6844249F148F1B6FD98040.description: Recognize common types of texts and different genres (e.g., storybooks, poems).

8BD8545D8B9E4CE59CD488A0F7A05C96.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

93DEF4A921454D45BDCD48F95E0BC78A.description: With prompting and support, retell key details from a shared read-aloud.

B369E3EA62664B3BB45D7C3465CCCF35.description: Actively and respectfully engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

445C4D36E21640FBBFACA43782ECF0E9.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

B59847EBF8924F108A59EE5679DC3643.description: With prompting and support, make text to text, text to self, and text to world connections including basic similarities in and differences.

58F26A0D47064AD98F386C17EF0B9196.description: Describe the relationship between illustrations and text in response to a teachers-directed read-aloud.

55801EA4C5A84D9188F10F8EA0440C28.description: With prompting and support,define the role of the author and the illustrator of a text.

DB705063D87A407C90A08B0C2134F9FE.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

3D88768F2B0D41D893AEECA0F5E52AF6.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

1773322ECDCD4E9CA11AE529C5CEC324.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

C00C6F23CE9440FD85FF38B803344638.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text read-aloud.

35198CD106A940A4AF072530F070C8CD.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text read-aloud.

75119CF5A68B4BB3BD8D43B979BA99B1.description: Fluently read a range of high frequency words (10-17) in a minute. d. Fluently read connected text of 2 or more sentences made up of decodable and high frequency words. For the purpose of fluency, the End-of-Year target was derived from range of researched-based high-frequency word list including Dibels.

AAB9E946803A4B2AB6C6806C43881AAB.description: Fluently decode and read a range of CVC words (7-12) in a minute.

4A991415AA3E4A579969C4EB418F82CE.description: Fluently and randomly name all 26 upper- and lower-case letters and their sounds including all 10 short- and long-vowel sounds.

06E5E93562F14C76B403DDDAE85766E6.description: Students will be able to with speed and accuracy:

25A063F7C409408C8430638FAD9603A2.description: Read simple sentences made up of decodable and high frequency words.

F8022124AB5047B28606D76C674E5203.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

02511C997CF44D0B996056A1258F76A9.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ (ex. hat to had; word families).

02CF389C0F2041A395A60D59FBAFE416.description: Recognize that every syllable must have a vowel sound to determine the number of syllables in a printed word.

2286318D22C844B184CDF7EC14200363.description: Associate the long and short sounds with the common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels (ex. cvc and cvce (kit to kite, cap to cape)).

B6D67C1FB918401BA20B53C1252260C1.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary and the most frequent sound(s) for each consonant (ex. hard/ soft c and g).

C413FB8AF1E843F98AD5B07F21909A04.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

E55542E0075147F682ADD3BBA86C3978.description: Add, substitute or manipulate individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

22ED2794A2C8449D97CB69C8C1E5A6CB.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

1E1AD286A04E415B82791A64CF307188.description: Blend and segments onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

B14FA10209CE4AE39136A9A0A9E79BB1.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

4B0D269DAC3F4F3F8B0A0EF442EFE433.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

8F7588BC12134298AFC353F4FB31BCD9.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

C58750AE75944AFFA5A1148D21074920.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequence of letter.

448618B2BAA74B3D9697387A6B98B6F0.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

BDB45B9D9D344356BE8A5FD585EBFF79.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.
